column2: The    Sexual Reproductive Health (SRH)    Consultant will be responsible for planning and conducting field operations, stakeholder management, conducting qualitative data collection during scoping of the project, hiring and training the enumerators, coordinating with the factory during the intervention phase, conducting training sessions with the Master trainer from external SRH agency (if required) and planning and conducting Baseline surveys, midline surveys and Endline survyes       Additionally, the consultant will be expected to take care of all the field logistics, attend project-related calls and maintain documentation of the field aspect of the project            Who are you           Bachelors or Masters degree in Public Health, Gender Studies, Social Work, or a related field     Proven experience in qualitative data collection, such as in-depth interviews and Focus group discussions           Qualitative Research and Data Collection:           Planning and executing the data collection process in the field and Conducting the expected surveys, in-depth interviews, and FGDs to gather insights and information to understand the SRH needs, challenges, and aspirations of female labourers.     Planning and managing data collection and ensuring good data quality and surveyor productivity throughout the project by following GBL data collection standards.     Supporting the team in translating the survey documents like the instrument and training manuals. In case the translations are being done by a third party, the consultant will be expected to vet the translations.           Training and Capacity Building:           Conducting training programs on SRH and related topics with an external SRH agency for female labourers and healthcare providers.     Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of training programs, making necessary adjustments for continuous improvement while playing a vital role in making field plans and resource mapping in the given timeline.           Stakeholder management:           Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to seek permission to conduct SRH training and data collection.     Raise awareness about SRH issues and promote the importance of comprehensive SRH care within the female labour force.           Report Writing and Documentation:           Ensuring project documentation is complete and well-maintained, including designing, maintaining, and tracking field reports/project logs in Google documents and spreadsheets, along with drafting and developing materials, manuals, guidelines, and field protocols as per project requirements.     Maintain accurate records of research data, training materials, and program evaluations.           Community Engagement:           Build strong relationships with female labourers, clinic healthcare workers, and other stakeholders to ensure their active participation in research and training activities.     Provide support and guidance to address individual SRH concerns and queries.           Project Management:           Planning and overseeing day-to-day work for the surveyors and field consultants/analysts, getting appointments, leading training along with analysts, speaking to partners to get prior permission to use their premises, making arrangements for travel and other logistics, providing feedback, follow-ups to the research and field team, ensuring good data quality, following protocols, securing and procuring required equipment and materials, and ensuring that survey equipment is functional. The role will require an end-to-end project management.     Hire, onboard, and train Field enumerators and perform additional duties as and when needed.           What should you be comfortable with             A dynamic environment with competing priorities.         Working in a team with shared responsibilities.         Independently coordinating with coworkers to accomplish goals.         Being resourceful in new environments and scenarios.         Problem-solving in high-pressure environments
column11: Administration, SAN, Project management, Data collection, Healthcare, Data quality, Business strategy, Public health, Logistics

column2: Position Overview: The Business Development Manager in the home healthcare industry plays a critical role in driving growth and expanding business opportunities for the organization. This position involves building strategic partnerships, identifying new market segments, and developing innovative business solutions to increase the organization's market share and revenue. Key Responsibilities: 1.  Market Research and Analysis : Conduct thorough market research to identify trends, opportunities, and competitive dynamics in the home healthcare industry. Analyze market data, customer needs, and industry developments to inform business strategies and identify areas for growth. 2.  Business Strategy Development : Collaborate with senior management to develop and implement the organization's business development strategy. Define target market segments, identify key value propositions, and establish short-term and long-term business goals. 3.  Partnership Development : Identify and establish strategic partnerships and collaborations with healthcare providers, insurers, community organizations, and other relevant stakeholders. Negotiate and manage partnership agreements to enhance the organization's service offerings and market reach. 4.  New Business Opportunities : Identify and pursue new business opportunities within the home healthcare industry. Develop innovative solutions, service lines, or programs to address emerging market needs and differentiate the organization from competitors. 5.  Sales and Marketing : Develop and implement sales and marketing strategies to generate leads, acquire new clients, and expand the organization's customer base. Collaborate with the marketing team to create compelling marketing materials, promotional campaigns, and digital marketing initiatives. 6.  Relationship Management : Build and maintain relationships with key clients, referral sources, and industry influencers. Conduct regular client meetings, presentations, and negotiations to foster long-term partnerships and ensure client satisfaction. 7.  Competitive Analysis : Monitor and analyze competitor activities, pricing, service offerings, and market positioning. Identify competitive advantages and develop strategies to address competitive challenges. 8.  Proposal Development : Lead the development and submission of business proposals and tender responses. Ensure timely and high-quality preparation of proposals that meet client requirements and maximize the organization's chances of securing new business. 9.  Performance Tracking and Reporting : Develop and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of business development efforts. Prepare regular reports and presentations for senior management, highlighting achievements, challenges, and recommendations for improvement. Requirements: - Bachelor's degree in business administration, healthcare management, or a related field (advanced degree preferred). - Proven experience in business development, sales, or marketing within the healthcare industry, preferably in home healthcare. - In-depth knowledge of the home healthcare market, trends, and reimbursement models. - Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills to assess market dynamics and identify growth opportunities. - Excellent negotiation, communication, and presentation skills to engage with clients and stakeholders at various levels. - Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with key decision-makers and influencers. - Results-driven mindset with a track record of achieving business targets and driving revenue growth. - Creative thinking and problem-solving abilities to develop innovative business solutions. - Familiarity with healthcare regulations, compliance, and privacy requirements. - Strong organizational and project management skills to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously. - Willingness to travel as required to meet clients and attend industry events. - Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel & PowerPoint.
column11: Pharma Selling, Healthcare Sales, Medical Rep, Pharma Marketing, Healthcare Marketing, Sales And Marketing, Medical Sales, Field Sales, Doctor Activities, Business Development, Pharmaceutical Sales

column2: As an SEO (Search Engine Optimization) Specialist, you will play a crucial role in enhancing the online visibility and search engine rankings of our company's digital assets. You will be responsible for implementing SEO strategies, optimizing website content, and staying abreast of industry trends to ensure maximum organic reach. The SEO Specialist will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive targeted traffic, improve user experience, and contribute to the overall digital marketing goals. Key Responsibilities: Keyword Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive keyword research to identify relevant and high-performing keywords.Analyze competitor strategies to stay ahead in the search landscape. On-Page SEO Optimization: Optimize website content, meta tags, headers, and other on-page elements for search engines.Ensure proper implementation of SEO best practices in website structure and design. Content Development: Collaborate with content creators to produce high-quality, SEO-friendly content. Create and optimize landing pages, blog posts, and other digital assets. Technical SEO: Audit and resolve technical issues that may impact search engine rankings (e.g., crawling, indexing, and site speed).Implement structured data markup to enhance search engine visibility. Link Building: Develop and execute link-building strategies to improve domain authority and increase the website's credibility. Identify and build relationships with relevant influencers and websites for link opportunities. Analytics and Reporting: Utilize tools such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and other SEO platforms to track and analyze website performance.Generate regular reports on key SEO metrics and provide actionable insights. Stay Informed and Educate: Keep abreast of industry trends, search engine algorithms, and best practices. Educate cross-functional teams on SEO principles and collaborate on integrated marketing campaigns. Collaboration: Work closely with web developers, designers, content creators, and marketing teams to align SEO efforts with broader business objectives. Communicate effectively to ensure a cohesive approach to digital marketing.
column11: Search Engine Optimization, Google Analytics, Analytical Skills, Content Marketing, Link Building, Keyword Research, Social Media Optimization, Content Strategy, Seo Tools, Project Management, Technical Seo, Off-page Optimization, Analytics Reporting, On-page Optimization

column2: Role & responsibilities     Develop statistical inputs for clinical study protocols in compliance with regulatory requirements. Conduct literature searches for sample size calculation and estimate sample size using SAS or R software. Generate randomization schedules for various study designs using SAS software. Calculate PK parameters and perform statistical analyses such as ANOVA and CI using SAS and WinNonlin software. Analyze highly variable and narrow therapeutic index drugs, following reference scaled approaches as per US-FDA, European, and Canadian regulatory guidelines. Validate statistical outputs generated using SAS/WinNonlin. Interpret statistical results and summarize findings in clinical study reports. Prepare biostatistics reports according to regulatory requirements. Develop, review, and implement SOPs for PK and statistical analysis in the respective departments. Perform statistical analysis of in-vitro binding bioequivalence studies, IVRT, and IVPT studies. Participate in regulatory audits (US-FDA, UK-MHRA, DCGI) for PK and statistical audits. Prepare technical justifications/responses to PK and statistical queries from sponsors and regulatory agencies. Provide training and guidance to lower-level and new staff in PK and biostatistics departments. Renew and upgrade SAS and WinNonlin software. Validate SAS/WinNonlin software (IQ, OQ, PQ). Coordinate with project management, clinical, and QA teams for project submissions.
column11: Clinical Research

column2: We are looking for a Senior Medical Writer to work with one or more clients in the FSP space; experience in Neuroscience or Oncology would be valuable but not essential. This would be a remote role working from any location in India.  As a Senior Medical Writer within the FSP team, you will provide high-quality medical and scientific writing from planning and coordination through delivery of final drafts to internal and external clients. The successful candidate may work across multiple FSPs. You will collaborate with internal and external clients, supporting and enabling effective and efficient communication that results in operational excellence. Essential Functions: Serves as primary author for FSP clients who writes and provides input on routine documents such as clinical study reports and study protocols and summarizes data from clinical studies. May research, write or edit complex clinical and scientific and program level documents, including IBs, INDs, and MAAs. Reviews routine documents prepared by junior team members. May provide training and mentorship for junior writers and program managers on document preparation, the use of software for document development, document types, regulatory requirements, and therapeutic area knowledge. Ensures compliance with quality processes and requirements for assigned documents. Provides input on and independently develops best practices, methods, and techniques for achieving optimal results, including various client specific processes. May assist in program management activities. Identifies and resolves out of scope activities. Duties could include developing timelines, budgets, forecasts, and contract modifications. Represents the department at project launch meetings, review meetings, and project team meetings. Education and Experience:  Bachelor's degree in a scientific discipline or equivalent and relevant formal academic / vocational qualification; Advanced degree preferred. Previous experience that provides the knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform the job (comparable to 5+ years). Experience working in the pharmaceutical/CRO industry preferred. Experience working within FSPs preferable. Additional qualifications in medical writing (AMWA; EMWA; RAC) advantageous. In some cases, an equivalency, consisting of a combination of appropriate education, training and/or directly related experience, will be considered sufficient for an individual to meet the requirements of the role. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:  Excellent data interpretation and medical writing skills, including grammatical, editorial, and proofreading skills Strong project management skills Excellent interpersonal skills including problem solving. Strong negotiation skills Excellent oral and written communication skills with strong presentation skills Significant knowledge of global, regional, national, and other document development guidelines In-depth knowledge in a specialty area such as preclinical, therapeutic, regulatory submissions, communications, etc. Great judgment and decision-making skills Excellent computer skills and skilled with client templates; Good knowledge of document management systems and other relevant applications (e.g., Excel, Outlook).
column11: Medical Writer, editorial, project management, regulatory submissions, pharmaceutical, data interpretation, regulatory, presentation skills, scientific writing, oncology, research, clinical research, clinical trials, clinical study report, protocols

column2: Principal Clinical Study Manager is at the heart of our Evidence Generation activities and aligned to our Cultural pillars of Go Beyond, Do What Matters Most and Keep it Human     The role provides operational leadership to the Clinical Study Team and is responsible for the planning, management, execution, and delivery of the trial according of the study to timelines, budget, and quality     The role will require a robust use of project management tools and operational practices     Study Team Leader and primary operational contact for 1-3 trials of average design and protocol complexity, including clinical trials, behavioral testing, and decentralized/virtual trials     Has the ability and agility to manage the delivery of any types of studies (complex/ unusual study designs, new indications, challenging regional environment and local regulations) and strategically influence the operational delivery     Responsible for the implementation, conduct and tracking of study trials in compliance with ICH/GCP and local regulations, company SOPs and written standards for the conduct of human subject research, study timelines, within budget and to project specifications     Provides operational and strategic leadership to assure successful delivery of trials     Oversight of clinical sites, CROs and vendor activities according to the Functional Service Provider (FSP) or Full-Service Outsourcing (FSO) models     Contributes to the plans and study documents from an operational standpoint, such as protocols, informed consent forms, monitoring plans, vendor contracts, clinical study reports, etc     Acts as HBS custodian Take on functional leadership responsibilities, providing expert consult for issue resolution, piloting new ways of working         Key role responsibilities:            Deliver in alignment with Haleon s purpose, strategy, and culture. Ensures studies are conducted in compliance with ICH/GCP and local regulations, Haleon s SOPs and other written standards.      Accountable for study and or project delivery, and therefore possesses a strong project management acumen that drives the coordination of study activities across cross functional disciplines      Accountable for the implementation, conduct and tracking of clinical trials, according to study timelines, within budget and to project specifications.      Functions as the Business Owner for all Clinical Development third-party vendors for the execution of responsible studies.      Develops study plan and forecast, including detailed schedule and budget      Develop, maintains, and drives regular review the study Risk Management Plan and contingency planning, and Study Oversight Plan and tracking.      Assures issue management and escalation according to Written Standards. Ensures appropriate follow-up actions are taken      Tracks delivery to time, cost, and quality, including maintenance of standard tools such as, Veeva Vault/CTMS, Finance Tool and MSProject      Prepares or oversees study management, monitoring and study plans      Drives After Action Reviews (AARs) and facilitates other learning activities          Miniumum Requirements:             Bachelor s degree in Science or Health-related field preferred.      10 years of significant experience in managing clinical research studies, clinical operations or equivalent. Has a established competencies in clinical research and clinical study management, associated regulatory, processes and quality requirements. T      Track record of success in continuous improvement, innovative work practices and driving changes to achieve these.      Demonstrated team leader experience either directly and/or as a matrix organization.      Demonstrated experience representing an organization with external stakeholders, including for example, Contract Research Organizations, Investigational Sites, Healthcare Organizations and External Experts.      Demonstrated business acumen.      Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English      Matrix management experience required.      Project management/leadership experience required

column2: Greetings From Prochant !!! JD for   Assistant Manager -Operations    Key Responsibilities and Duties:   The Assistant Manager is responsible for several areas that are key to success for the Prochant, an outsourced billing service in the U.S. healthcare industry. In this role you are essentially play a vital role in the growth of the company. You are responsible for identifying issues in all process and altering the concern department. A deep and thorough understanding of the entire process followed by Prochant production workers in all shifts is a must. Duties include overall responsibility for smooth running of all process simultaneously alerting management of concerns and red flags. In addition, you are responsible for highlighting the requirements to the Manager for leading India Operation and implementing the requirement with the guidance of the manager to meet the short term and long term goal. Finally, you will be responsible personally coach, train and mentor the Senior Team Leaders.  Essential Functions  Transition   He /She will be go to person (India SPOC) from Chennai operations on transition of all new clients and projects. He/ She should coordinate with the US Operations/Transition team to on-board new clients/projects as per transition methodology best practices.    Project Management:  Document, update and execute transition project plan to ensure that we meet quality, timeliness, ramp-up and other contractual needs of the clients. Keep accurate tracking of resources and milestone critical items to deliver on the client and business needs.    Cost Management:  Ensure accurate estimation and modeling of staffing and other resources to manage revenue per head and gross margin targets. Keep a tab on the cost as we execute projects, to deliver on those targets.    Communication:  Keep stakeholders updated on the high probable and signed-off projects. Take inputs from sales pipeline and other transition meetings to augment plans. Escalate if there are needs that are unmet to deliver on the transition deliverables. Single point of contact for new clients/projects hiring inputs to HR    Monitoring   overall responsibility for monitoring all process during transition period  Cash,  Billing, Transmission, Correspondence, MIS, Support, Medicare Audit Process, AR process, EV/PA Process.   Operations : Responsible for MIS, audit and support team as laid out below    Review Metrics   Review all teams Account Metrics and update Manager on issue based clients.   Training   Responsible for reviewing performance of team members and responsible for conducting training or development opportunities for them.    Resource Allocation   overall responsible to make necessary changes in staffing based on day or week, TAT expectation and other anticipated events.    Communication   Addressing Complaints and resolving problems for both employees and clients. Escalate to next level based on severity of the issue. review emails and communicating frequently with the Manager and Account Managers regarding the process improvisation   Process Management  overall responsible for managing sub ordinates and ensure the overall process movement is in the right direction as per the requirement of the company, coordinating with the Sr. Team leaders, Manager, Account Managers regarding planning, assigning and directing.    Recruitment Inputs  Responsible for prioritizing the recruitment coverage with HR team.   Key Competencies  Deep and thorough understanding of Prochant production policies and procedures. Advanced DME industry and DME billing knowledge and experience. Exceptional verbal, interpersonal, and written communication skills. Organized, detail-oriented and self-motivated. Ability to juggle multiple responsibilities. Professional presentation skills and confidence when speaking. Exceptional problem-solving skills to analyze issues and identify potential liabilities. Strong leadership skills to promote personal and professional development and teamwork. Ability to maintain strong professional relationships with internal teams and management. Consistent demonstration of a professional, positive attitude. A strong, working understanding of computers and an ability to self-troubleshoot simple issues.  Critical Success Factors  Self-Confidence  The Assistant Manager can diplomatically express views that may be unpopular. Decisive despite uncertainties. Self-Control  The Assistant Manager is composed, positive, clear thinking and focused under pressure. Conscientiousness  The Assistant Manager is organized and careful in work, meeting deadlines and commitments. Innovation  The Assistant Manager is open to new ideas, approaches and information. Achievement Drive  The Assistant Manager constantly strives to improve standardsof excellence. Commitment  The Assistant Manager makes sacrifices to meet goals and believes inthe mission and core values of the organization. Initiative ??The Assistant Manager pursues goals beyond what is required or expectedof them. Optimism ??The Assistant Manager is persistent despite obstacles and setbacks and expects success, not failure. Understanding ??The Assistant Manager respects the feelings and perspectives of others and takes interest in their concerns. Service Orientation ??The Assistant Manager anticipates, recognizes and meets customer needs and offers help. Influence ??The Assistant Manager can effectively guide others. Communication ??The Assistant Manager deals with difficult issues. Listens well. Seeks mutual understanding and resolve. Confidentiality ??The Assistant Manager protects patient rights by maintaining confidentiality of personal health and financial information.   Benefits Salary & Appraisal - Best in Industry Excellent learning platform with great opportunity to build career in Medical Billing Quarterly Rewards & Recognition Program Dinner for Night Shift Upfront Leave Credit Only 5 days working (Monday to Friday) No of openings : 1 Experience : 8+ years Shift timing : Night Shift Mode Of Interview : Zoom / Teams Contact Person : Abdul Wahab Interested candidates call / whats app to 8248165076 or share your updated CV to abdulwahab@prochant.com

column1: Senior Health Economics Consultant - Infectious Diseases
column2: This is an opportunity to work for ICON Global Health Economics and Epidemiology (HE&Epi), a division of ICON plc, an international clinical research organisation headquartered in Dublin, Ireland.     We are currently seeking a Lead Consultant, with strong technical expertise in infectious disease modelling and strong project management skills, to join our team.     The HE&Epi team works in a range of disease areas. In addition to observation studies using a variety of study designs, including prospective and retrospective data collection, analysis of clinical and administrative databases, and systematic literature reviews, we conduct studies to estimate the health impact and cost-effectiveness of interventions, including vaccines, targeting infectious diseases, with a view to informing client and national policy decisions.     The Lead Consultant will manage projects and is expected to provide expertise relating to the critical review of relevant literature to inform model conceptualisation, design and parameterisation. They will also contribute to the programming of dynamic infectious disease models and associated cost effectiveness analyses and to the reporting and interpretation of findings.     At ICON we pride ourselves on advancing the science/consultancy interface; we have a strong reputation and publication record for observational, interventional, and modelling studies in a wide variety of clinical areas and where appropriate we seek to increase the credibility of our work through peer-reviewed publication.             Role requirements:           MSc or PhD in Infectious Disease Epidemiology, or a related field         Technical knowledge of dynamic transmission modelling and economic modelling, and the ability to provide support and mentoring to junior team members         The ability to design conceptual model frameworks, program dynamic transmission models in C++ and R, link these to economic analyses in Excel and to collect and interpret available data, such as sentinel surveillance data, to inform model designs and calibration         The ability to prepare study protocols and reports         Strong project management skills and the ability to serve as the main point of contact for clients         Ability to manage complex projects         Ability to lead a project team         Excellent organizational skills including strong oral and written English communication skills, coupled with strong interpersonal skills         Detail oriented with the ability to multi-task efficiently                   Additional valuable skills would include:           Advanced VBA Excel proficiency         Familiarity with the workings of major National Immunisation Technical Advisory Groups (eg JCVI, ACIP, PBAC)         Experience in proposal writing and business development activities
column11: Administration, Proposal writing, C++, Excel, Pharma, Project management, Data collection, Clinical research, Healthcare, Public health

column2: Company Overview: Sitero is a leading organization specializing in clinical research and healthcare solutions. We are dedicated to advancing medical research and improving patient outcomes through innovative technologies and services. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Sr. Clinical Reports Programmer to join our team and contribute to our mission. Position Overview The Sr. Clinical Reports Programmer is responsible for the development and maintenance of reporting systems that manage and analyze clinical trial data. This role demands a strong foundation in programming, a deep understanding of clinical data, and the ability to communicate complex information in an accessible format to support clinical research and operations. With a focus on reports development, SSRS reporting, application integration, and SSIS package expertise, the Sr. Reports Programmer will drive the setup, customization, and automation of reports tailored to clinical trials. Joining our team presents an opportunity to contribute directly to the optimization of clinical trials within the clinical research domain. The ideal candidate for this position should possess proficiency as a Reports developer with expertise in SSRS reporting, application integration, and data export/import via SSIS package. Additional skills preferred are BI, Tableau, SAS, R, Python, PL/SQL, SQL, Logi Analytics etc. Primary Responsibilities Develop and refine clinical trial and study reports and dashboards using Pl/SQL, SQL, R, Python, SAS, and deploy through SSRS and SSIS. Utilize BI and Tableau for advanced data visualization and user-friendly report interfaces. Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, ensuring a deep understanding of data structures and sources for precise report specifications. Implement stringent data validation and quality control to guarantee report accuracy. Automate ETL processes for streamlined report generation and performance optimization. Conduct internal and external user testing to refine reports based on feedback, focusing on intuitive design and effective data visualization. Document development processes, including specifications, validation plans, and version histories, maintaining high standards of compliance with GCP, FDA regulations, and other guidelines. Offer technical support and training to users, enhancing their ability to interpret and utilize report data effectively. Secondary Responsibilities Maintains Quality Service and Departmental Standards by Reading, understanding and adhering to organizational Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) Assisting in establishing and enforcing departmental standards Contributes to team effort by Working with internal staff to resolve issues Exploring new opportunities to add value to organization and departmental processes Helping others to achieve results Performing other duties as assigned Maintains Technical and Industry Knowledge by Attending and participating in applicable company-sponsored training Qualifications Education: Bachelor?? degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field required Educational background in human-computer interaction, usability, user-centered design, user experience, information design, applied psychology, cognitive science, human factors, informatics, computer science, or other design/applied science fields is a plus. Experience: 10+ years??experience in clinical data reporting or a similar role within a clinical research or healthcare setting. Proficiency in SQL and experience with clinical database management systems like EDC, IRT or CTMS.  Knowledge of SAS, R, or Python is highly advantageous. Knowledge of Logi Analytics is highly advantageous. Knowledge of visualization tools like BI, Tableau etc. Familiarity with clinical data standards (e.g., CDISC) and regulatory compliance requirements related to clinical data reporting. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to interpret complex clinical data. Excellent problem-solving abilities and the capacity to work under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Effective communication skills, with the capability to present data and reports to both technical and non-technical audiences. Additional skill set: Ability to work in group setting and independently; ability to adjust to changing priorities Excellent attention to detail and orientation toward meticulous work Strong interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written Strong documentation and organizational skills Ability to project and maintain a professional and positive attitude Role & responsibilities

column2: If you meet the qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, please send your updated resume to  Careers.kkm@kauveryhospital.Com  with the subject line "Application for Pharmacy Head  Position". For any inquiries or further information, feel free to contact Sravya at  7200384396.  Role & responsibilities     Leadership:  Provide visionary leadership to the pharmacy department, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement. Team Management:  Recruit, train, and mentor pharmacy staff, ensuring adequate staffing levels and professional development opportunities. Operational Oversight:  Oversee all aspects of pharmacy operations, including medication procurement, inventory management, dispensing, compounding, and distribution. Regulatory Compliance:  Ensure compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and accreditation standards governing pharmacy practice, including those set forth by regulatory agencies and professional organizations. Clinical Services:  Collaborate with healthcare providers to optimize medication therapy, promote medication safety, and improve patient outcomes through clinical pharmacy services. Quality Assurance:  Implement quality assurance measures to monitor and evaluate the safety, effectiveness, and appropriateness of medication use processes. Technology Utilization:  Leverage technology and automation to streamline pharmacy operations, enhance medication management processes, and minimize medication errors. Budget Management:  Develop and manage the pharmacy department budget, optimizing resources and controlling costs while ensuring the delivery of high-quality pharmaceutical services. Performance Improvement:  Lead initiatives to identify opportunities for performance improvement and implement strategies to enhance pharmacy operations, efficiency, and patient satisfaction. Collaboration:  Collaborate with other healthcare professionals and departments to promote interdisciplinary teamwork and achieve organizational goals related to patient care and safety. Preferred candidate profile     Licensed pharmacist in tamilnadu pharmacy council of India. Minimum of 10 years of progressively responsible experience in hospital pharmacy practice, with at least 3 years in a leadership or management role. Strong leadership and managerial skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a diverse team of pharmacy professionals. Thorough understanding of pharmacy operations, including medication procurement, distribution, and clinical services.   Preferred Qualifications: Board Certification in Pharmacotherapy or a related area of practice. Advanced degree - Master of Business Administration, Master of Healthcare Administration. Experience with implementing and managing pharmacy informatics systems. Experience with process improvement methodologies ( Lean Six Sigma). Active involvement in professional organizations related to pharmacy practice.

column2: Position Summary The Company uses an EDC (Electronic Data Capture) System to retrieve, store and analyze patient data. The EDC System is constantly maintained and updated. After every maintenance work and before the release of every new update or bug correction, the System must be tested prior to release to ensure uninterrupted user experience and data integrity and quality. This process of putting the EDC System through various stress-test scenarios and ensuring that the System behavior is the desired one is called UAT (User Acceptance Testing). The UAT Tester oversees this procedure. Main Duties & Responsibilities  Creates UAT scenarios to validate the operation of the EDC System, according to specifications.  Implements those scenarios in a DEMO environment prior to release and observe the Systems output.  Communicates with developers to debug the System in cases where the System does not behave according to specifications.  Repeats the above steps until the Systems performance is consistent and according to specifications.  Complies with the Company's Quality and Information Security Management Systems and applicable national and international legislation, including legislation for data protection.   Professional Experience requirements  Required: Fluent computer skills (ICDL desired)  Desired: Basic knowledge of a software testing framework   Language Skills Required    - Excellent command of spoken and written English    Key competencies - Ability to work independently but also as part of the team - Ability to work with multiple priorities and tight deadlines
column11: User Acceptance Testing, UAT, User Acceptance, Acceptance Testing

column2: Position Summary: The Regulatory Submissions Manager has primary responsibility to co-ordinate the delegated study start-up and submission activities in various countries, in collaboration with Veeda cross functional teams, in-country regulatory reams & Sponsors. Activities daily consist of overseeing regulatory activities for trials assigned & manage local teams; directing the preparation and submission of regulatory application. Main Duties & Responsibilities:  Collaborates with study management team and Sponsor / MAHs if applicable, for the study set-up planning activities  Confirms study start-up strategy and milestones.  Participates in the preparation of the Core Clinical Trial Application and Amendments.  Provides input / performs QC on the content of study essential documents from a regulatory perspective.  Leads & supports local teams & sub-contracted CROs to ensure timely delivery of relevant activities throughout the lifecycle of the trial.  Performs QC on the content of local submission packages and documents locally adapted, to ensure timeliness, accuracy, comprehensiveness, or compliance with regulatory standards as required.  Prepares and co-ordinates action plan in relation to comments received, in collaboration with Veeda cross-functional team, local teams or sub-contracted CROs and Sponsor / MAHs if applicable.  Ensures that the mandatory regulatory requirements are in place to comply with countryspecific requirements.  Ensures that TMF is up to date.  Delivers and maintains client-focused reporting to measure performance and proactively identify issues for resolution  Provides input for bids in relation to regulatory submission activities and supports relevant budget oversight and reconciliation  Maintains relevant company systems and/or tools  Assists in relevant regulatory SOPs and guidelines' writing and maintenance  Builds and maintains relationships with clients and key personnel within customer companies  Complies with the Company's Quality and Information Security Management Systems and applicable national and international legislation, including legislation for data protection.     Professional Experience requirements: - Prior experience in the preparation of CA / C(EC) submissions for Clinical Trial Applications, ideally across regions. - Professional level experience in clinical research. - Commitment to high standards of operational excellence. - Knowledge of current European guidelines / knowledge of regional guidelines and regulations is preferred, as well as the ability to understand new guidelines and regulations.    Language Skills Required:  - Excellent command of English, both oral and written.  Key competencies: - Advanced knowledge of ICH/GGP guidelines / regulatory history, guidelines, policies, standards, practices, requirements, and precedents / any other legislation that may impact clinical studies - Experience in regulatory submission activities - Strong operational management with attention to detail and organizational skills - Able to work independently and make appropriate strategic decisions to operationalize and move the clinical trials forward - Experience operating effectively within a matrix environment - Highly effective interpersonal skills to lead a team through negotiation, coaching & mentoring - Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills - Excellent computer skills - Ability to deal adequately with complex tasks and flexible timelines
column11: Regulatory Affairs, clinical trial application, Regulatory Submissions, C EC submissions, European guidelines, CA submissions

column1: Openings For Radiology Medical Coders in NTT DATA
column2: Greeting from  NTT DATA,  We are happy to take your profile for a wonderful career with  NTT DATA.     In these roles, you will be responsible for: Abstracting information from provider patient medical records and hospital ancillary records per facility and/or state requirements. Assigning appropriate billing codes based on medical documentation using CPT-4, HCPCS and/or ICD-10 CM coding guidelines. Querying physicians when code assignments are not straightforward or documentation in the record is inadequate, ambiguous or unclear for coding purposes. Monitoring unbilled accounts report for outstanding and/or un-coded encounters to reduce accounts receivable days. Following strict coding guidelines within established productivity standards. Addressing billing/coding related inquires for providers as needed, U.S. only. Attending meetings and in-service training to enhance coding knowledge, compliance skills, and maintenance of credentials. Maintaining patient confidentiality.   Required Skills for this role include: 1+ years of experience working with CPT, HCPCS and ICD-10 CM coding principles, governmental regulations, protocols and third party requirements regarding medical billing and experience in radiology coding. 1+ year of experience analyzing medical records in any medical coding specialty. Good understanding on CCI edits. Interested Candidate can send me your resume to Ganga.Venkatasamy@nttdata.com

column2: Greetings From Prochant !!! JD for Assistant Manager -Operations Key Responsibilities and Duties:   The Assistant Manager is responsible for several areas that are key to success for the Prochant, an outsourced billing service in the U.S. healthcare industry. In this role you are essentially play a vital role in the growth of the company. You are responsible for identifying issues in all process and altering the concern department. A deep and thorough understanding of the entire process followed by Prochant production workers in all shifts is a must. Duties include overall responsibility for smooth running of all process simultaneously alerting management of concerns and red flags. In addition, you are responsible for highlighting the requirements to the Manager for leading India Operation and implementing the requirement with the guidance of the manager to meet the short term and long term goal. Finally, you will be responsible personally coach, train and mentor the Senior Team Leaders. Essential Functions Transition   He /She will be go to person (India SPOC) from Chennai operations on transition of all new clients and projects. He/ She should coordinate with the US Operations/Transition team to on-board new clients/projects as per transition methodology best practices. Project Management:   Document, update and execute transition project plan to ensure that we meet quality, timeliness, ramp-up and other contractual needs of the clients. Keep accurate tracking of resources and milestone critical items to deliver on the client and business needs. Cost Management:   Ensure accurate estimation and modeling of staffing and other resources to manage revenue per head and gross margin targets. Keep a tab on the cost as we execute projects, to deliver on those targets. Communication:   Keep stakeholders updated on the high probable and signed-off projects. Take inputs from sales pipeline and other transition meetings to augment plans. Escalate if there are needs that are unmet to deliver on the transition deliverables. Single point of contact for new clients/projects hiring inputs to HR Monitoring   overall responsibility for monitoring all process during transition period Cash, Billing, Transmission, Correspondence, MIS, Support, Medicare Audit Process, AR process, EV/PA Process. Operations: Responsible for MIS, audit and support team as laid out below Review Metrics   Review all teams Account Metrics and update Manager on issue based clients. Training   Responsible for reviewing performance of team members and responsible for conducting training or development opportunities for them. Resource Allocation   overall responsible to make necessary changes in staffing based on day or week, TAT expectation and other anticipated events. Communication   Addressing Complaints and resolving problems for both employees and clients. Escalate to next level based on severity of the issue. review emails and communicating frequently with the Manager and Account Managers regarding the process improvisation Process Management   overall responsible for managing sub ordinates and ensure the overall process movement is in the right direction as per the requirement of the company, coordinating with the Sr. Team leaders, Manager, Account Managers regarding planning, assigning and directing. Recruitment Inputs   Responsible for prioritizing the recruitment coverage with HR team. Key Competencies Deep and thorough understanding of Prochant production policies and procedures. Advanced DME industry and DME billing knowledge and experience. Exceptional verbal, interpersonal, and written communication skills. Organized, detail-oriented and self-motivated. Ability to juggle multiple responsibilities. Professional presentation skills and confidence when speaking. Exceptional problem-solving skills to analyze issues and identify potential liabilities. Strong leadership skills to promote personal and professional development and teamwork. Ability to maintain strong professional relationships with internal teams and management. Consistent demonstration of a professional, positive attitude. A strong, working understanding of computers and an ability to self-troubleshoot simple issues. Critical Success Factors Self-Confidence The Assistant Manager can diplomatically express views that may be unpopular. Decisive despite uncertainties. Self-Control The Assistant Manager is composed, positive, clear thinking and focused under pressure. Conscientiousness The Assistant Manager is organized and careful in work, meeting deadlines and commitments. Innovation The Assistant Manager is open to new ideas, approaches and information. Achievement Drive The Assistant Manager constantly strives to improve standardsof excellence. Commitment The Assistant Manager makes sacrifices to meet goals and believes inthe mission and core values of the organization. Initiative The Assistant Manager pursues goals beyond what is required or expectedof them. Optimism The Assistant Manager is persistent despite obstacles and setbacks and expects success, not failure. Understanding The Assistant Manager respects the feelings and perspectives of others and takes interest in their concerns. Service Orientation The Assistant Manager anticipates, recognizes and meets customer needs and offers help. Influence  The Assistant Manager can effectively guide others. Communication  The Assistant Manager deals with difficult issues. Listens well. Seeks mutual understanding and resolve. Confidentiality  The Assistant Manager protects patient rights by maintaining confidentiality of personal health and financial information. Benefits Salary & Appraisal - Best in Industry Excellent learning platform with great opportunity to build career in Medical Billing Quarterly Rewards & Recognition Program Dinner for Night Shift Upfront Leave Credit Only 5 days working (Monday to Friday) No of openings : 1 Experience : 8+ years Shift timing : Night Shift Mode Of Interview : Zoom / Teams Contact Person : Abdul Wahab Interested candidates call / whats app to 8248165076 or share your updated CV to abdulwahab@prochant.com

column2: Position's Overview At NTT DATA, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our companys growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring, the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA and for the people who work here. NTT DATA, Inc. currently seeks a ??Configuration  Analysis Advisor?? to join our team.  Client's business problem to solve? Our client provides access to high-quality healthcare, innovative programs and a wide range of health solutions that help families and individuals get well, stay well. NTT is contracted to manage provider pricing configuration which involves Payor Platform configuration, perform UAT, Integration Testing and Audit. Our NTT Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) team has helped client to improve productivity, TAT and quality to strengthen the configuration area and help our customer relationship stay competitive and improve member and provider satisfaction. Position's General Duties and Tasks In these roles you will be responsible for:  Configuring client System for Pricing (Provider Contract) as per the requirement and according to defined business rules of new claims processing platform. Evaluation of Configuration Requirement and Formulation of Configuration Approach and Effectively include advanced configuration and additional functionality based on best practices Based on the business requirements and business rules gathered, evaluate and create rules and complete the configuration activities  Participate in problem solving of Health Plan benefit, provider, pricing, reporting, operational and system issues Perform a variety of tasks related to the resolution of production support issues based on client configurations with the core administrative system Support activities to update configuration within the core claims processing system, typically within the areas of Provider Pricing. Potential responsibilities include and may vary by system area of assignment Support fee schedule changes including terms, affiliations and contract maintenance Enable User Analysis Testing (UAT) and implement the modifications as suggested by the business owners and/or analyst Creating manual test cases from Use cases, Functional specs and other requirement documents. Resolve coding/QA issues by managing Master Issue Logs and Fixing the high priority change requests which require immediate attention Data Validation and Audit of existing plans and contracts in the client database(s) Database Management & Maintenance Requirements for this role include:  Candidates must have Over all 5+ years??experience in US healthcare Claims Payer. 8 + year(s) experience in Configuring client System for Pricing (Provider Contract) and UAT testing ??2+ Years. High school diploma or equivalent required, Technical/ Non-Technical Associate degree, technical college or some college course work preferred. Ability to work within a project-oriented environment. People Management  Any healthcare application (Facets/QNXT/Amisys/DST) Preferences:   -  Experience in SQL 2+ Years (Queries Writing) Exposure on VB/Vb.net.   Required schedule availability for this position is Monday-Friday (5:00am to 3:00pm EST).  The shift timings can be changed as per client requirements. Additionally, resources may have to do overtime and work on weekend?? basis business requirement.

column2: Greetings From Prochant !!! Key Responsibilities and Duties:   As a Team Leader you are responsible for several areas that are key to success for the Prochant, an outsourced billing service in the U.S. healthcare industry. In this role, you are accountable to manage the team and ensure production and quality targets are met as per company requirement. You are responsible for identifying issues and alerting the appropriate parties before these issues are identified by the client. Your job is to enhance and expand the capacity of your team members, allowing Prochant to expand the scope of its teams to include a much larger client base. Essential Functions Production Monitoring - overall responsibility for monitoring daily production for assigned clients and updating the Connect Portal with this information. Review Reports review key reports for accuracy and quality. These reports include: Production log (Target Vs. Achieved), Cash posting log, Cash to back reports, Transmission log such as claims entry log, commercial rejection log, BT rejection log and printing log. Daily Standing Meeting - Prepare respective report for daily meeting, reporting results and associated red flags. Always bring proposed solutions when reporting these issues. Allocation of work - Prepare downloads of respective process and allocate the work to the subordinates and ensure a smooth flow of production. Escalations - Identifying issues, resolving and escalating it to the Senior Team Leader and Managers . Quality Assurance - Overall responsible for the quality of the team for all Day process. Communication - Good rapport with Senior Team Leader and Assistant Manager, review emails and tasks typically sent to the Senior Account Manager and respond or forward as appropriate, taking a significant work load off of the SAM. Month End - overall responsibility for ensuring that month end procedures like Client invoicing reports and month end closing reports are maintained in timely manner. Training - Interface with the training team based on red flags and accuracy issues to ensure proper staff education. Performance Review - Periodic one to one meeting on Performance review. Team Meeting - Responsible to conduct Team meetings on regular basis to update and coordinate the Team performance Note: we are looking for the candidate who have mandatory experience in payment posting, charge entry, FEB, rejection and denials. Benefits Salary & Appraisal - Best in Industry Excellent learning platform with great opportunity to build career in Medical Billing Quarterly Rewards & Recognition Program Dinner for Night Shift Upfront Leave Credit Only 5 days working (Monday to Friday) Contact Person : Abdul Wahab Interested candidates call / whats app to 8248165076 or share your updated CV to abdulwahab@prochant.com

Responsibilities:  Lead and supervise a team of Prescription Drug Claims Associates  Develop, implement, and monitor team workflow processes to optimize efficiency and accuracy.  Train and mentor team members on claim processing procedures, medical terminology, and insurance coding  Review and approve team processed claims.  Identify and resolve complex claim processing issues.  Escalate unresolved issues to appropriate channels.  Monitor team performance metrics and identify areas for improvement.  Ensure adherence to company policies and procedures, and industry regulations.  Manage team workload and prioritize tasks.  Communicate effectively with team members, pharmacies, providers, and other stakeholders.  Stay up to date on relevant regulations and guidelines for billing and coding. Qualifications:  Bachelors degree in Pharma or Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or a related field (preferred)  Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in a healthcare claims processing role, with at least 2 years in a supervisory or lead position  Excellent English Verbal and written communication is a MUST.  Proven experience in managing and motivating a team.  Strong understanding of medical terminology, insurance billing codes, and claim processing procedures.  Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills  Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills  Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)  Ability to work independently and as part of a team.  Strong organizational and time management skills

This role is a vital part of the team to accomplish tasks and projects that are instrumental to the company's success. If you are interested in an exciting career where you can use your expertise and develop and grow your career even further, then this is the opportunity for you. Our culture is of expertise, and we empower our teams to employ their unique talents and experience to take an assertive approach to research, problem solving, and ultimately supporting our business partners. column2: Job Title:  Sr.Webinar Executive (MBBS/BDS) Company:  Medvarsity Online Limited Location:  Hyderabad, Banjara Hills Job Type:  Full-time Website:  assimilate.one About Medvarsity: Medvarsity is leading the charge in transforming global healthcare education. With a presence spanning from Hyderabad to the UK, and soon expanding into the USA, we are not merely a company but a dynamic movement. Our dedicated custom content development teams are instrumental in driving this mission forward, crafting tailored educational solutions for esteemed hospitals, pharmaceutical giants, and healthcare organizations worldwide. By integrating cutting-edge technology and digital methodologies, we empower the healthcare sector with unparalleled educational experiences. Job Description: We are seeking a dynamic and motivated MBBS/BDS doctor to join our team as a Webinar Executive. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing all aspects of webinar programs, including speaker recruitment, program management, hosting, and collaboration with the marketing team. This role requires excellent communication skills, strong organizational abilities, and a passion for medical education. Key Responsibilities: Relationship Management: Identify and reach out to potential speakers within the medical community. Establish and maintain relationships with key opinion leaders and subject matter experts. Coordinate with the medical affairs team to ensure speakers meet accreditation and quality standards. Program Management: Develop webinar content in collaboration with speakers and content experts. Create detailed program schedules and timelines for webinar events. Coordinate logistics, including webinar platform setup, technical support, and participant registration. Webinar Hosting: Host live webinars, ensuring smooth execution and adherence to schedules. Facilitate Q&A sessions and engage participants during webinars. Troubleshoot technical issues and provide support to speakers and participants as needed. Collaboration with the Marketing Team: Work closely with the marketing team to promote webinar events and increase attendance. Provide input on marketing strategies, including email campaigns, social media promotions, and website content. Track and analyze webinar performance metrics to measure effectiveness and identify areas for improvement. Qualifications and Skills: MBBS/BDS degree from a recognized medical university. Strong understanding of medical terminology and concepts. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Organizational and time-management abilities to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Technical proficiency in webinar hosting platforms and online collaboration tools. Prior experience in medical education, event management, or marketing is a plus. Camera-friendly and Collaborative. Job Type: Full-time
column11: Relationship Building, Bds, Coordination, Relationship Management

column2: A career in our Managed Services team will provide you an opportunity to collaborate with a wide array of teams to help our clients implement and operate new capabilities, achieve operational efficiencies, and harness the power of technology      Our Revenue Cycle Managed Services team will provide you with the opportunity to act as an extension of our healthcare clients revenue cycle functions      We specialize in front, middle and back office revenue cycle functions for hospitals, medical groups, and other providers      We leverage our custom and automated workflow and quality assurance products to enable our clients to achieve better results, which ultimately allow them to provide better patient care      As an Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution          PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:                  The quality control analyst conducts quality control audits of patient accounts referred to the Revenue Cycle Managed Services (RCMS) and assures company and client standards are maintained and the integrity of client services are preserved        The Quality Control Analyst will perform a variety of functions including, but not limited to: reviewing and monitoring accounts, identifying problems, analyzing trends and suggesting recommendations for improvements      This role consults with and takes direction from the Continuous Improvement Specialist to resolve quality and efficiency issues that may occur on any given project                 2-4      years is required in the following areas:                Medical collections (Medical Collections Specialist II preferred), billing and/or claims experience              Customer service experience              All payer knowledge required (government and non-government)                    Responsibilities                Performs quality control audits; reviews and monitors accounts;              Identifies problems, analyzes cause and effect, and suggests recommendations for improvement;              Provides daily constructive feedback based on account notation;              Identifies areas of weakness and communicates recommendations on changes and improvement to Continuous Improvement Specialists;              Document findings of analysis. May prepare reports and suggests recommendations of implementation of new systems, procedures or organizational changes;              Relies on specific instructions and pre-established guidelines to perform the functions of the job;              Possesses ability to be confidential; Supports company compliance by demonstrating adherence to all relevant compliance policies and procedures; demonstrates knowledge of HIPAA Privacy and Security Regulations as evidenced by appropriate handling of sensitive information;              Consults and collaborates with Continuous Improvement Specialist to identify and assess training needs based on work audited;              Participate in quality control meetings;              Possesses considerable leadership skills, fostering an atmosphere of trust; seeks diverse views to encourage improvement and innovation; coaches and develops staff through timely and meaningful written feedback;              Possesses a cooperative and positive attitude toward management and co-workers by responding politely and professionally and being a valued team player; and,              Exemplifies extensive knowledge of the hospital revenue cycle with specialization in healthcare billing, follow-up, and the account resolution process to include, but not limited to: claims submission, acceptance, and adjudication, transaction reviews, adjustment posting, identification of patient responsibility, etc                Required Knowledge and Skills:                Good analytical and math skills;              Able to document problems and assist in their resolution;              Demonstrated ability exceeding all established department/client quality and productivity standards;              Proven ability to lead by example and foster mentoring relationships;              Strong written and oral communication skills;              Computer and internet literate in an MS Office environment; and,              Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships              US Healthcare Commercial and Managed Care Insurance Claim Management/Billing/Claim Edit Resolution              US Healthcare Medicare and Medicaid Insurance Claim Management/Billing/Claim Edit Resolution              US Healthcare Denials Management (technical and clinical)              US Healthcare Underpayment/Payment Variance Management                        Desired Knowledge / Skills:                Quality Assurance              HIPAA Privacy and Security Regulations with payer knowledge              Epic Resolute, HB and PB Patient Accounting              Cerner RevElate Patient Accounting              Meditech Patient Accounting                Professional and Educational Background      :                High school diploma or GED required; Associates Degree preferred              Additional Certifications: Medical Billing Certification preferred                      Travel Requirements:    Travel to client locations may be required as per project requirements.

column2: Job Description: Executive Assistant to Managing Director Position:  Executive Assistant to Managing Director Department:  Executive Office Reports to:  Managing Director (MD) Location:  Andheri East, Mumbai.   Job Summary: The Executive Assistant to the Managing Director (MD) provides high-level administrative support to the MD and ensures the efficient operation of the executive office. This role requires a proactive, detail-oriented, and highly organized individual who can manage a wide range of administrative and executive support-related tasks with minimal supervision. The Executive Assistant will act as a gatekeeper and confidant for the MD, managing schedules, communications, and special projects, while maintaining a high level of confidentiality.   Key Responsibilities: Administrative Support: Manage and maintain the MDs calendar, including scheduling appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements. Screen and prioritize incoming communications (emails, phone calls, etc.), responding on behalf of the MD when appropriate. Prepare and edit correspondence, reports, presentations, and other documents. Handle confidential information with discretion. Meeting and Event Coordination: Organize and coordinate meetings, including preparing agendas, distributing meeting materials, and taking minutes. Arrange logistics for board meetings, executive team meetings, and other company events. Ensure the MD is well-prepared for meetings and events. Project Management: Assist the MD with special projects, including research, data analysis, and report preparation. Track and follow up on ongoing projects and initiatives to ensure timely completion. Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to facilitate project execution. Travel and Logistics: Arrange domestic and international travel plans, including flight bookings, hotel reservations, and transportation. Prepare detailed itineraries and travel documentation. Handle travel-related issues and emergencies as they arise. Office Management: Maintain and organize the executive office, ensuring it is tidy and efficient. Order office supplies and handle maintenance requests. Serve as a point of contact between the MDs office and other departments. Communication and Relationship Management: Build and maintain positive relationships with key stakeholders, including board members, senior executives, clients, and partners. Represent the MD in interactions with employees, clients, and other external parties. Facilitate effective communication and information flow within the organization. Additional Duties: Handle personal tasks and errands for the MD as needed. Stay informed about industry trends and the company?? strategic initiatives. Perform other related duties as assigned to support the MD and the executive office.   Qualifications: Education:  Bachelor?? degree in Business Administration, Communications, or related field preferred. Experience:  Minimum of 1 year of experience as an Executive Assistant or in a similar role supporting senior executives. Skills and Abilities: Exceptional organizational and time-management skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and other relevant software. Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment. High level of discretion and confidentiality. Professional demeanour and strong interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team.   Working Conditions: Work Environment:  Primarily an office setting with some travel required. Hours:  10:30 am to 7:30 pm or as per confirmation from MD

column2: Position Overview: We are seeking highly motivated individuals to join our team as Executive AR, or Senior Executive AR. The primary responsibility of this role is to communicate with insurance companies in the US on behalf of Physicians/Clinics/Hospitals to follow up on outstanding Accounts Receivables. The ideal candidate should possess excellent communication skills, a strong understanding of the U.S. Healthcare Domain (provider side), and proficiency in Revenue Cycle Management (RCM). Key Responsibilities: - Make outbound calls to insurance companies to follow up on outstanding claims. - Hands on experience into denial management.  - Convince insurance companies to process payments for outstanding claims. - Demonstrate sound knowledge of U.S. Healthcare Domain (provider side) and suggest methods for improvement. - Maintain basic knowledge of Revenue Cycle Management (RCM). - Develop and manage collaterals as required. - Coordinate with Team Leader for client updates. - Meet productivity and quality targets within defined Turnaround Time (TAT). - Identify and escalate issues to the Team Leader/Manager as necessary. - Update production logs accurately and timely. - Adhere to company policies, rules, and regulations. - Follow quality processes using provided checklists. - Ensure compliance with HIPAA guidelines. - Responsible for adhering to all Quality Management System (QMS) and Information Security Management System (ISMS) policies and procedures. If you meet the above qualifications and are looking to grow your career in the healthcare industry, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Regards, Shama HR Executive 9606032618 Shama.fayaz@acnhealthcare.com ACN Healthcare RCM Services Pvt. Ltd.

column2: Role & responsibilities     Financial Record Keeping : The Accounts Executive is responsible for maintaining accurate financial records of the hospital's transactions, including patient billing, insurance claims, vendor invoices, and other financial documents. This involves recording transactions in the accounting system, reconciling accounts, and ensuring compliance with accounting standards and regulations. Budgeting and Financial Analysis : They assist in the preparation and monitoring of the hospital's budget, analyzing variances between budgeted and actual expenses, and providing financial reports and analysis to management. This helps in identifying areas for cost-saving measures and optimizing financial performance. Accounts Payable and Receivable Management : The Accounts Executive oversees accounts payable functions, ensuring timely payment of vendor invoices while adhering to payment terms and policies. They also manage accounts receivable, including billing patients and insurance companies, processing payments, and following up on outstanding balances to ensure prompt collection. Financial Reporting and Compliance : They prepare financial statements, such as balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements, on a regular basis to provide management with insights into the hospital's financial health. Additionally, they ensure compliance with relevant financial regulations and reporting requirements, such as HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act) and GAAP (Generally Accepted Accounting Principles). Audit and Internal Controls : The Accounts Executive plays a key role in coordinating external audits and implementing internal controls to safeguard the hospital's assets and ensure the accuracy of financial reporting. This involves conducting periodic audits of financial processes, identifying weaknesses or discrepancies, and implementing corrective actions as needed to mitigate risks. Preferred candidate profile   MALE CANDIDATES ONLY WITH minimum 2 years , Graduates in Commerce/Accounting with Hospital accounting experience preferred. column1: Opening with Health Care organization For Claims associate, Noida
column2: Opening with Health care organization for Claims associate, Noida Dear Aspirants, Hiring Alert! This is Lavanya.P from Allegis Global Solutions (www.allegisglobalsolutions.com) . As the leading provider of workforce solutions, and with services across 60+ countries, we innovate, consult, design, and implement successful, creative, and data-driven talent solutions across all workforce categories.. We know what it takes to attract the best talent while designing and executing strategies that align workforce capabilities with the agility required to stay ahead of whats next. Allegis Global Solutions is currently looking for a Claims associate role for one of our Healthcare based client - Noida. About the Team: Our client is a for-profit American multinational managed healthcare and insurance company based in Bloomfield, Connecticut. It is a health benefits provider that advocates for better health through every stage of life. As the health benefits provider , we guide our customers through the health care system, empowering them with the information and insight they need to make the best choices for improving their health and vitality. Roles and Responsibilities: Job Description attached. Main Duties / Responsibilities  A medical claims processor should adjudicate the claims in line with the policy coverage and medical necessity and validates the information on all medical claims from member and providers seeking payment.  Claims must be thoroughly reviewed to ensure that there is no missing or incomplete medical information.  Able to accurately assess medical eligibility within the guidelines and give evidence-based advice on claims, considering internationally accepted protocols and local and/or regional customs and regulations.  Should have the ability to review, investigate and respond to external and internal inquiries/complaints and provide guidance to others related to medical necessity.  a processor must keep meticulous records of claims and follow up on lapsed cases.  Medical claims processors are expected to have an extensive knowledge of medical terminology, as well as experience using a computer.  Recording and maintaining insurance policy and claims information in a database system.  Determining policy coverage and calculating claim amounts.  Processing claims payments.  Answering queries related to Policy coverage criteria and guidelines.  Complying with federal, state, and company regulations and policies.  Since medical claims processors must approve or deny payment to doctors, it is vital that they know how to correctly read and assess medical documents.  Good communication skills are necessary to converse with doctors' offices or insurance companies if there is a problem with the claim.  Achieving required targets assigned on daily, weekly and monthly basis.  Performing other clerical tasks, as required. Experience & Qualification: Only medical Bachelors/Master, (Bpharma, Mpharma, BDS, BAMS) Knowledge & Skills Required: Claims adjudication, claims management, health claims. Please do revert with your interest and updated resume to lprakash@allegisglobalsolutions.com and your availability to connect for a telephonic discussion. Kindly share the following details with us . 1. Current Company 2. Experience in the Mandatory education ( Only medical Bachelors/Master, (Bpharma, Mpharma, BDS, BAMS) 3. Current CTC 4. Expected CTC 6. Notice Period Role & responsibilities   Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits
